channel.title: Tried everything
channel.description:
Alright, did some Java a while ago, been a while, I'm a little rust, I remember how to do something but some others are totally forgotten. This problem is probably an easy fix but everything I have tried to do has failed.
Basically I am making a control panel, I have a decent GUI laid out and I have got all the actions doing what they should do, everythign should work once I get it hooke dup. My problem is getting the file to load with the server.
Not sure how to go about doing this. I was pretty sure including the class file and then running main(); in Server.java's main. "ControlPanel.main();" but it wont even include the file. It says it's not there, but I have the java file where it should be.
[code]import server.ControlPanel;[/code]
and my ControlPanel.java is currently in my server directory
I am using Project Insanity base.

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

But I am looking for the ControlPanel(); method in my ControlPanel class file -.-

EDIT :

adding new ControlPanel();

to my main method in Server.java gives no errors, when starting up it still doesn’t start my GUI.

EDIT 2 :

new ControlPanel().setVisible(true);

Holy fuck… It was that simple… I love how Java can be so simple yet so complicated at the same time.

Thanks for the help everyone!

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

new ControlPanel(); will call public ControlPanel()
You cant do
controlPanel.ControlPanel();
Or it will look for the method ControlPanel.

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

Well I keep on trying to call methods from my ControlPanel but I keep getting errors like this

src\server\Server.java:97: cannot find symbol symbol : method ControlPanel() location: class ControlPanel.ControlPanel controlPanel.ControlPanel(); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Phaze One:

Invoke a true statement to the controlPanel.main();

I am not entirley sure about what you’re saying.

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Invoke a true statement to the controlPanel.main();

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

It is but seeing I can’t figure that out I just tried

import ControlPanel.ControlPanel;

No errors!

EDIT :

Alright, another problem…

src\server\Server.java:97: main(java.lang.String[]) in ControlPanel.ControlPanel cannot be applied to () controlPanel.main(); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

I added controlPanel.main();

to Server.java’s main method.

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

NVM!!!

import ControlPanel.ControlPanel;

^^^ that seemed to work :D. Thanks for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

So I just did some playing around and found what might be the problem (not to sure) I have the class files in my bin/server folder. I have the ControlPanel.java file in my src/server folder. When I compile (without adding anything to my server so there are not errors) everything compile fine, but it doesn’t compile the class files of ControlPanel.java to my bin/server folder… It actually goes to bin/ControlPanel (makes a new folder and everything.

Could this be a problem, if so how to I get it to put my class files into my bin/server folder?

Read full topic

item.title: Tried everything
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:351397”]ControlPanel controlPanel= new ControlPanel();
And than you can simply do

controlPanel.METHOD;

src\server\Server.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : class ControlPanel location: class server.Server ControlPanel controlPanel= new ControlPanel(); ^ src\server\Server.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : class ControlPanel location: class server.Server ControlPanel controlPanel= new ControlPanel(); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors

If I add

import server.ControlPanel;

I manage to get another error

src\server\Server.java:32: cannot find symbol symbol : class ControlPanel location: package server import server.ControlPanel; ^ src\server\Server.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : class ControlPanel location: class server.Server public static ControlPanel controlPanel= new ControlPanel(); ^ src\server\Server.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : class ControlPanel location: class server.Server public static ControlPanel controlPanel= new ControlPanel(); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I Vain I:

May I see your Control Panel class?

Probably not.

Read full topic
